text.0: all is with thee o indra all the treasures which erst our fathers won who sang thy praises.
text.1: with thee are milchkine good to milk and horses best winner thou of riches for the pious.
text.2: for like a king among his wives thou dwellest with glories as a sage surround and help us.
text.3: make us thy servants strong for wealth and honour our songs wirth kine and steeds and decoration.
text.4: here these our holy hymns with joy and gladness in pious emulation have approached thee.
text.5: hitherward come thy path that leads to riches may we find shelter in thy favour indra.
text.6: vasiṣṭha hath poured forth his prayers desiring to milk thee like a cow in goodly pasture.
text.7: all these my people call thee lord of cattle may indra come unto the prayer we offer.
text.8: what though the floods spread widely indra made them shallow and easy for sudās to traverse.
text.9: he worthy of our praises caused the simyu foe of our hymn to curse the rivers fury.
text.10: eager for spoil was turvaśa purodas fain to win wealth like fishes urged by hunger.
text.11: the bhṛgus and the druhyus quickly listened friend rescued friend mid the two distant peoples.
text.12: together came the pakthas the bhalanas the alinas the sivas the visanins.
text.13: yet to the trtsus came the Āryas comrade through love of spoil and heroes war to lead them.
text.14: fools in their folly fain to waste her waters they parted inexhaustible paruṣṇī.
text.15: lord of the earth he with his might repressed them still lay the herd and the affrighted herdsman.
text.16: as to their goal they sped to their destruetion they sought paruṣṇī een the swift returned not.
text.17: indra abandoned to sudās the manly the swiftly flying foes unmanly babblers.
text.18: they went like kine unherded from the pasture each clinging to a friend as chance directed.
text.19: they who drive spotted steeds sent down by pṛśni gave ear the warriors and the harnessed horses.
text.20: the king who scattered oneandtwenty people of both vaikarna tribes through lust of glory.
text.21: as the skilled priest clips grass within the chamber so hath the hero indra wrought their downfall.
text.22: thou thunderarmed oerwhelmedst in the waters famed ancient kavasa and then the druhyu.
text.23: others here claiming friendship to their friendship devoted unto thee in thee were joyful.
text.24: indra at once with conquering might demolished all their strong places and their seven castles.
text.25: the goods of anus son he gave to trtsu may we in sacrifice conquer scorned pūru.
text.26: the anavas and druhyus seeking booty have slept the sixty hundred yea six thousand.
text.27: and sixandsixty heroes for the pious were all these mighty exploits done by indra.
text.28: these trtsus under indras careful guidance came speeding like loosed waters rushing downward.
text.29: the foemen measuring exceeding closely abandoned to sudās all their provisions.
text.30: the heros side who drank the dressed oblation indras denier far oer earth he scattered.
text.31: indra brought down the fierce destroyers fury he gave them various roads the paths controller.
text.32: een with the weak he wrought this matchless exploit een with a goat he did to death a lion.
text.33: he pared the pillars angles with a needle thus to sudās indra gave all provisions.
text.34: to thee have all thine enemies submitted een the fierce bheda hast thou made thy subject.
text.35: cast down thy sharpened thunderbolt o indra on him who harms the men who sing thy praises.
text.36: yamuna and the trtsus aided indra there he stripped bheda bare of all his treasures.
text.37: the ajas and the sigrus and the yaksus brought in to him as tribute heads of horses.
text.38: not to be scorned but like dawns past and recent o indra are thy favours and thy riches.
text.39: devaka mānyamanas son thou slewest and smotest Śambara from the lofty mountain.
text.40: they who from home have gladdened thee thy servants parasara vasiṣṭha satayatu.
text.41: will not forget thy friendship liberal giver so shall the days dawn prosperous for the princes.
text.42: priestlike with praise i move around the altar earning paijavanas reward o agni.
text.43: two hundred cows from devavans descendant two chariots from sudās with mares to draw them.
text.44: gift of paijavana four horses bear me in foremost place trained steeds with pearl to deck them.
text.45: sudāss brown steeds firmlystepping carry me and my son for progeny and glory.
text.46: him whose fame spreads between wide earth and heaven who as dispenser gives each chief his portion.
text.47: seven flowing rivers glorify like indra he slew yudhyamadhi in close encounter.
text.48: attend on him o ye heroic maruts as on sudāss father divodāsa.
text.49: further paijavanas desire with favour guard faithfully his lasting firm dominion.
